meanings.definition: A salt marsh, especially one in arid regions.
meanings.sent1: The salina was a vast area of marshland filled with salty water.
meanings.sent2: Birds often gather around the salina to feed on the small creatures living in the salty water.
meanings.sent3: The ducks decided to have a party at the salina, but they couldn't find any fresh water to drink!
meanings.sent4: The salty smell of the salina hung in the air like a heavy blanket.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the colors reflected in the salina created a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: A salt flat or salt pan.
meanings.sent1: The vast salina stretched out before us, shimmering in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The salina was so flat that you could see your reflection in the salt crystals.
meanings.sent3: The race car sped across the salina, leaving a trail of salt dust behind.
meanings.sent4: The salina looked like a giant mirror reflecting the clear blue sky above.
meanings.sent5: Walking barefoot on the salina felt like stepping on a bed of tiny diamonds.

meanings.definition: A place where salt is produced by the evaporation of seawater.
meanings.sent1: The workers toiled under the hot sun to harvest the salt from the salina.
meanings.sent2: Ships would come to the salina to transport the harvested salt to other regions.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally mistook sugar for salt from the salina, creating a very salty dessert!
meanings.sent4: The salt crystals from the salina sparkled like diamonds in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The salty breeze from the salina carried the taste of the sea to the nearby town.
